Dear Jason M Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001327
Special Investigation Intake Date: April 9, 2024
License #: CI410201226
Licensee Group Organization: Wedgwood Christian Services
Licensee Designee: David Gorman
Chief Administrator: Jason M Lheureux
Agency Name: KENTWOOD CAMPUS
Agency Address: 3290 36TH ST
GRAND RAPIDS, MI 49512-8193
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 03/01/2025
Capacity: 36

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/6/24 Youth A was restrained by a staff. On 4/8/24 Youth A
had bruises on his face, chest and arms. These marks are
believed to be from being restrained. Youth A reported he was
thrown against a wall and to the floor during the restraint.
Investigation Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
4/9/2024 and 4/30/24. Administrator was interviewed again
face to face at the facility on 4/11/2024 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker. He reported knowing of the allegations and
having a plan where Staff 1 will not be working with Youth A until
this investigation is completed. He also reported since the
incident, Youth A has been doing much better and appears to be
adjusting to the program since Youth A has only been in the
program for a few weeks. Administrator reported Youth A fought
the restraint and was throwing Youth A’s body around the room
while displaying aggression towards staff. He reported speaking
2

with Foster Care Worker and Youth A’s mother, and neither were
upset over the incident. Both reported Youth A has a temper and
will act out violently when not getting what Youth A wants. He
reported there was a mix up in the communication when
scheduling the visit for Youth A with Youth A’s mother thus the
visit on the day of the incident was canceled. Foster Care Worker
was to provide the supervision during the visit but since Foster
Care Worker was unable to attend and the facility did not have the
appropriate ratio of staff to conduct the visit, the visit was canceled
until two days later. Administrator reported being told by
Supervisor 1 that Youth A stated, Youth A was going to get staff
fired because they restrained Youth A. He provided a copy of the
video recording that was made during the incident and reported
the camera view does not show the part of the incident near the
entrance door. Administrator reported the camera view has been
adjusted so more of the room is visible in the camera view.
Youth A was observed face to face at the facility on 4/9/2024.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
4/11/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A
reported being in the program for one month and the incident
outlined in the allegations occurred the prior weekend. Youth A
reported he took the keys out of Staff 2’s pocket and attempted to
leave the unit. Staff 2 pushed Youth A and grabbed the keys.
Youth A reported walking around the unit kicking and banging on
each door in an attempt to get the door open so Youth A could
leave. Youth A reported hitting Staff 2 in the face because Youth A
was angry. Youth A reported Staff 1 started a restraint of Youth A
by grabbing and holding Youth A’s arms behind Youth A’s back.
Youth A reported this occurred near the entrance door and Youth
A hit his chin on the door frame. Youth A jumped up and tried to
climb on a table before falling backwards taking Youth A and Staff
1 to the floor. Youth A believed Staff 1 fell on top of Youth A but
then stated he was not sure if Staff 1 fell on top of him. Youth A
then stated Staff 1 “threw” Youth A to the ground. Once up from
the ground, Youth A began to throw apples at Staff 1 hitting Staff 1
in the head. Youth A reported Staff 1 pushed Youth A causing
Youth A to lose consciousness. Youth A reported being seen by
Nurse following the incident. Youth A reported going down the
hallway on the unit and using a jacket to attempt self-harm. Staff 1
and Staff 2 were able to take the jacket from Youth A. Youth A
reported the other youth on the unit were in their rooms during the
restraint and there were no witnesses.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
4/11/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B
3

reported being on the unit during the incident but didn’t see
anything. Youth B also reported feeling safe at the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
4/11/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C
reported observing the incident before going to Youth C’s room.
Youth A took Staff 2 keys before hitting Staff 2 and throwing an
apple twice at Staff 1. Youth A broke several items and was
restrained by Staff 1 and Staff 2. Youth C reported Staff 2 was
unable to hold Youth A in a restraint, so Staff 1 took over, but
Youth A was fighting the restraint. Youth A got hurt by punching
things and trying to break the keypad next to the door. Youth A
was scratched on his arms when hitting things and falling to the
ground because Youth A was so aggressive. Youth C reported
Staff 1, Staff 2, Supervisor 1, and Supervisor 2 were all
appropriate during the incident. Youth C reported feeling safe at
the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 4/11/2024
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported Youth A
grabbed Staff 2’s keys and ran towards the outer door. Staff 2 was
able to catch Youth A and take the keys back. Youth A went down
the hallway slamming Youth A’s backpack against doors and
trying to get another door open. Staff 1 and Supervisor 2 followed
Youth A down the hallway trying to de-escalate Youth A. Staff 1
reported “switching out” with Supervisor 1 and stayed standing at
the door to the milieu so Staff 1 could watch Youth A and Staff 2
while still keeping an eye on the other youth in the milieu. Youth A
took a jacket and hung it on another door and acted like Youth A
was going to hang Youth A by the jacket. Staff 2 got the jacket
from Youth A and Youth A left the hallway running past Staff 1 and
into the milieu. While in the milieu, Youth A began to destroy items
such as the key reader and fire alarm. Youth A was kicking doors
and broke a cup by slamming it on the ground. Youth A attempted
to grab a coffee mug, but Staff 1 was able to grab the mug first.
The other youth present in the milieu were taken out of the area
for safety and staff continued to try and de-escalate Youth A. Staff
1 reported Youth A was making racial remarks and threatening to
get staff in trouble. As staff were moving closer to Youth A, Youth
A moved like Youth A was going to strike Staff 1, Staff 2, and
Supervisor 2 and then grabbed a pen yelling Youth A was going to
stab staff with the pen. Youth A then the pen while Staff 2 was
standing in front of Youth A. At this time Supervisor 2 went to
assist in getting the other youth into the bedroom hallway and
away from the situation. As Staff 2 was talking with Youth A,
Youth A hit Staff 2 in the head and Staff 1 moved forward to
4

engage in the restraint. Staff 1 reported after engaging in the
restraint, Youth A tried to climb the wall before jumping on a table.
Staff 1 reported using a restraint technique that he was trained in
which involve holding Youth A from behind in a standing position
with one arm under Youth A’s arm and the other arm under Youth
A’s other arm and hand on Youth A’s shoulder. Once on the table,
Youth A lost balance and fell backwards into Staff 1 causing both
of them to fall to the ground. Once on the ground, Staff 1 let go of
Youth A who began to grab pieces of the broken plastic from the
cup Youth A threw to the ground earlier. Youth A began to move
towards Staff 1 as if Youth A was going to try and cut Staff 1.
Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 were able to get the plastic from Youth A,
who then threw three apples at Staff 1, striking Staff 1 in the face
with one of the apples. Youth A threw a table at Staff 1 before
ramming into Staff 1’s stomach with Youth A’s head. Staff 1
reported Supervisor 3 entered the room and helped Supervisor 2
and Staff 2 block Youth A from getting to Staff 1. Youth A
scratched his arms and neck. Staff 1 made sure to stay as far
away from Youth A as possible, so Youth A was not escalated by
Staff 1. A few minutes later, Youth A began to calm down and
Supervisor 2 talked to Youth A. Since the incident, Staff 1 has not
worked with Youth A.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
4/11/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth D
reported being present during most of the incident involving Youth
A. He reported being told to go to his room by Staff 1, Staff 2, and
Supervisor 2. He went to his room but returned to the door leading
to the milieu that had a small window which he reported to have
observed the restraint. Prior to going into the bedroom hallway,
Youth D reported Staff 1, Staff 2, and Supervisor 2 were very
patience with Youth A because Youth A was spitting on them and
throwing apples at them. The staff were speaking to Youth A in a
calm voice. Youth D reported Staff 2 stopped Youth A from
breaking the fire alarm and Youth A hit Staff 2 in the head a
“couple of times”. Youth D reported this is when Staff 1 began the
restraint of Youth A. This is the time Youth D was standing behind
the bedroom hallway door looking through the window. Youth D
reported Staff 1 began the restraint by holding Youth A against the
outside door and Youth D believed this is when Youth A hurt his
chin, however, Youth D also reported someone (unable to identify)
told him, Youth A got the mark on his chin as a result of the fall to
the floor. Staff 1 was pushing Youth A against the outside door
and held Youth A against the outside door with his leg. Youth D
reported Staff 2 and Supervisor 2 were standing near the restraint.
5

Supervisor 2 informed Youth D he needed to return to Youth D’s
room. Youth D reported feeling safe at the facility.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
4/11/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
when first coming on the unit, Supervisor 1 sent the other youth to
their rooms because Youth D and several other youth (unable to
identify) wanted to fight Youth A because of Youth A’s behaviors.
Youth A was in Youth B’s room at the time and fearful to come out
of Youth A’s room because of the other youth’s statements of
wanting to beat Youth A up. Supervisor 1 observed a mark on
Youth A’s chin and had Youth A take Youth A's shirt off to observe
Youth A’s arms and chest. She reported there was red marks on
Youth A’s arms and chest and Youth A’s right hand was bruised.
Youth A told Supervisor 1 the hand was hurt because Youth A
was punching things. Youth A informed Supervisor 1 that Staff 1
threw Youth A against the wall putting weight on Youth A, while
“trying to kill” Youth A. Supervisor 1 informed Youth A that
Supervisor 3 informed her, Youth A was hitting Youth A in the face
and scratching Youth A on the arms and chest while saying Youth
A was going to get Staff 1 fired. Supervisor 1 reported sending a
text about this to Administrator. Supervisor 1 reported telling Staff
1 to stay away from Youth A and not to work with Youth A.
Supervisor 1 spoke with Youth A’s mother about the situation.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 4/11/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 reported Youth A was
“down” because the visit with Youth A’s mother was cancelled
earlier in the day. Youth A spent some time in Youth A’s room and
finally came out and sat next to Staff 2. Youth A took Staff 2 keys
out of her pocket and ran to the outside door, but Staff 2 had no
key fob on her chain, so Youth A was unable to unlock the door
before Staff 2 walked over to Youth A and took the keys back.
Staff 2 reported first asking for the keys and having Youth A begin
yelling to be let out of the facility. Youth A went down the bedroom
hallway “kicking doors and yelling” until reaching the exit door.
Staff 2 was standing in front of the exit door when Youth A took a
jacket out of Youth A’s backpack. Youth A draped the jacket over
the hinge, made a knot and put Youth A’s head through the knot.
Staff 2 reported undoing the knot and throwing the jacket to Staff
1. Staff 2 reported Youth A left the hallway and entered the milieu
where Youth A threw a cup which broke on the ground and walked
to the main door. Staff 2 followed Youth A who was punching and
kicking the door before turning and punching Staff 2 in the head.
Supervisor 2 called the nursing department at this time and Staff 1
initiated a restraint with Youth A. Youth A tried to head butt Staff 1
6

and step on Staff 1’s feet. Youth A kicked off a table and both
Youth A and Staff 1 fell to the floor with Staff 1 falling on Youth A.
Youth A got up from the ground and screamed “I’m getting you all
fired” before grabbing and throwing apples at Staff 1. Youth A
picked up pieces of apple and hit Staff 1 in the face with the
pieces before throwing Youth A’s body at Staff 1. Youth A picked
up a broke piece of plastic from the cup Youth A had thrown
earlier and went after Staff 1. Youth A ran after Staff 1 and hit the
door headfirst, falling to the ground. After Staff 1 got the plastic
from Youth A, Youth A found a pen and tried to stab himself just
before Supervisor 3 came into the unit. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
used appropriate behavior management techniques and she was
unaware of any youth looking out of the hallway door window. She
believed no youth was watching the events since leaving the
milieu.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
4/11/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
Youth A asked to go to Youth A’s room after learning his visit with
his mother was canceled. Youth A returned to the milieu.
Supervisor 2 heard a loud banging noise. When she came out of
the office, Staff 1 told her Youth A had reached into Staff 2’s
pocket and taken Staff 2’s keys. When Supervisor 2 observed
Youth A, Youth A was in the hallway in a “rage” and cursing at
everyone. Youth A was punching the wall with Staff 1 standing at
the entrance to the hallway. Supervisor 2 reported leaving the
hallway to call for support (Supervisor 3 and nursing department)
and turn off the stove in the kitchen where she had been preparing
dinner. After coming out of the kitchen, Youth A was in the milieu
with a backpack turning over chairs and tables. She tried to de-
escalate Youth A but to no avail and Youth A threw a cup breaking
it on the ground. Staff 2 and Staff 1 helped move chairs and other
items Youth A was attempting to throw. Staff 1 placed Youth A in
a standing hold after Youth A punched Staff 2 in the head. Youth
A climbed on a table causing Staff 1 and Youth A to fall to the
ground and Staff 1 let go of Youth A as they were falling. Staff 1
was unable to get a good hold on Youth A because Youth A kept
head butting Staff 1. Youth A was thrashing around and remained
in a rage while grabbing broken plastic off the floor and attacking
Staff 1 with the plastic. Youth A threatened to cut himself with the
plastic before throwing fruit at Staff 1 and hitting Staff 1 in the
face. Youth A found a pen and threated to harm himself again.
Youth A was presenting with suicidal and homicidal ideations
lasting about 30 to 40 minutes. After Supervisor 3 came to help,
Youth A began to calm down. Youth A yelled Staff 1 was going to
get fired. Supervisor 2 reported not observing any youth looking
7

through the window in the door of the bedroom hallway, but she
was able to see the restraint through the window in the office
where she made the phone calls. She denied observing Staff 1
ever push Youth A into the wall. After speaking with Youth A’s
mother, Youth A’s mother is reported to not be surprised by the
rage Youth A was displaying.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
4/11/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported
responding to a call. As soon as he entered the unit, he observed
Youth A being physically aggressive towards Staff 1, Staff 2, and
Supervisor 2. Staff 2 and Supervisor 2 were standing between
Youth A and Staff 1 with Staff 1 standing behind a table and away
from Youth A. Youth A was saying all the staff were going to be
fired and Foster Care Worker was going to get Youth A out of this
program. Youth A attempted to pull the fire alarm off the wall
before attacking Staff 2. Staff 2 put out her hands to block Youth
A’s fists. Supervisor 3 stepped between them, and Youth A started
swinging at Supervisor 3 to which Supervisor 3 blocked with his
hands. Youth A increased the verbal aggression while Supervisor
2 continued with the verbal de-escalation. Supervisor 3 reported
when Youth A was not able to strike Supervisor 3, Youth A began
to spit on Supervisor 3 causing Supervisor 3 back up, giving more
space. Youth A ran after Supervisor 2 causing Supervisor 3 to
step between them again. Finally, Youth A began to calm down.
Supervisor 3 reported while Youth A was punching and kicking the
door, Youth A hit himself in the face. Supervisor 3 never observed
a mark on Youth A's chin but did a few days later. Supervisor 3 did
notice bruising on Youth A’s upper arms.
Nurse was interviewed via phone on 4/25/2024. She reported
observing Youth A on 4/8/2024 and receiving information from
staff following the restraint on the day of the restraint. In her
observation of Youth A, she noted that the bruise on his chin was
inconsistent with the information about being slammed against the
door frame by Youth A. She reported if Youth A was slammed
against the door frame, there would be other marks rather than
just a small bruise on Youth A’s chin. She believed Youth A may
have received the mark on his chin when falling to the floor
although, Youth A reported falling backwards at the time. She
reported the marks on Youth A’s arm appears to be from a finger
but could have been caused when Staff 1 and Youth A fell to the
floor and didn’t appear to be malicious in any manner. It appears
that the grip was tightened at some point.
8

Documents Reviewed:
Incident Report 179340236 for Youth A dated 4/9/2024. This
document outlines the events of the incident reported in the
allegations. There was a physical restraint of Youth A taking place
in the Zondervan Home on the campus of Kentwood. The
description of the incident on this document matches the
descriptions given by Staff 1, Staff 2, and Supervisor 2.
Nursing Note dated 4/6/24 for Youth A. This document outlines
the on-call information provided to the RN on duty. Nursing was
notified Youth A was involved in a restraint that lasted
approximately 2-3 minutes and no injuries were reported. At this
time Youth A continues to be escalated. Nursing was notified
Youth A had sustained an injury to Youth A’s hand and arm from
punching the wall. It is documented Youth A scratched himself
and staff provided ice and ibuprofen. Staff requested nursing
speak with doctor regarding a PRN for Youth A when Youth A
becomes escalated and aggressive. Supervisor 1 notified nursing
Youth A had a bruise on Youth A’s chin, upper left arm, left hand,
and chest. Youth A had reported no pain but when on the phone
with Youth A’s mother, Youth A complained of pain. Supervisor 1
reported if Youth A reports any pain tomorrow, then a referral to
ED to rule out fracture. Nursing will follow up and complete an
assessment of injuries on Monday.
Nursing Note dated 4/8/24 for Youth A. This document outlines
the nursing exam of Youth A following the restraint outlined in the
allegations. It is documented staff (unidentified) informed nursing
that the restraint took place due to Youth A becoming assaultive
towards staff, punched a wall, charging staff and a door, and
scratching and hitting self. The nursing exam documented Youth
A reported an injury to the right parietal region on his head, but
nursing found no swelling, lumps, bumps, or lacerations on Youth
A’s head. In regard to Youth A’s arms, nursing found a series of
bruises on Youth A’s upper left arm triceps. Nursing identified the
bruising appeared consistent with someone holding Youth A’s
arm. Nursing also identified a very small (smaller than the head of
a pin) skin break that Youth A reported was due to a scratch.
Nursing identified a 3-inch bruise on Youth A’s right tricep/bicep.
Youth A had minor bruising on Youth A’s right wrist but had full
movement. Youth A denied pain in his fingers and reported this
injury occurred when he hit the door/wall with Youth A’s forearm
and again with Youth A’s hand. Nursing also identified 3 small
bruises on Youth A’s right pec. The bruises are the size of a dime.
9

Wedgewood Crisis Management Policy 05-02 dated 7/13/23.
This document outlines the use of Physical Management
(Personal Restraint). It is stated “When a youth poses an
imminent danger to self or others, physical management is used
as a last resort”.
Wedgewood Behavior Management Policy 05-01 dated
7/13/23. The document outlines that staff are to use supportive
behavior management techniques involving de-escalation
approaches to help the youth engage in positive ongoing
activities.
Wedgewood Behavior Management (recommended
techniques) Policy 05-01.1 dated 7/13/23. The techniques
recommended include positive and proactive interventions with
youth. This involves 19-techniques ranging from physical
proximity, expectations, and one-to-one. Each of these techniques
builds on positive regard for the youth and providing an
environment for the youth to feel safe, thus being able to de-
escalate and make better choices. Staff are to provide space for
the youth and use warm empathy statements to help with the de-
escalation.
Wedgewood Behavior Management (prohibited techniques)
Policy 05-01.1.2 dated 7/13/23. This document outlines
techniques staff are not to use when dealing with youth in the
program including corporal or physical punishment.
Video recording of bedroom hallway on 4/6/24 was reviewed
on 4/30/24. This video recording has a view from the milieu door
at the beginning of the bedroom hallway to the end of the hallway
which has a locked exit door. Several times throughout the video,
Youth A is observed to be banging and kicking against the exit
door and attempting to break something on the hallway wall next
to the exit door. Youth A is observed kicking, punching, and hitting
his bedroom door with his backpack, feet, and hands several
times before attempting self-harm with his jacket. Staff was
observed to be close by and intervened when Youth A attempted
to hang himself with the jacket. Throughout this video Staff 2 and
Supervisor 2 are observed speaking to Youth A. Staff 1 only
enters the camera view at the end following the jacket incident.
There is not interaction between Youth A and Staff 1 and no
physical contact between the Staff 1, Staff 2, and Supervisor 2
and Youth A observed.
10

Video recording of Milieu on 4/6/24 was reviewed on 4/30/24.
This video recording has a limited view of the milieu area and the
area where the restraint was to have taken place is not in the
view. This video does show Youth A running into Staff 1 and
headbutting Staff 1 in the stomach area. Youth A can be viewed
throwing chairs at Staff 2 and Supervisor 2 and pushing a table
into Staff 1. Never are staff observed placing hands on Youth A
and they keep distance from Youth A. Staff 1 is observed to keep
his hands in his pockets generally away from Youth A.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, written documentation, and video review staff
restrained Youth A using the trained and approved restraint
technique. Youth A’s reported thrashing and attacking staff
present as causing Youth A’s various marks during the restraint.
None of the staff present reported any inappropriate techniques by
Staff 1.
Technical Assistance
Technical assistance was offered to the facility for the need to
improve the camera angles. The agency has already indicated
they have adjusted the camera view but an upgrade with a fisheye
camera is needed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
5/15/2024

Paul Fatato Date
Licensing Consultant

11
